sense.def: ① Etiological Agent. identical with SJZL 瘴氣① zhang qi , miasmatic qi. Sheng ji zong lu 聖濟總錄 37: 瘴者，山川厲 毒之氣。 “As for miasma , this is a violently poisonous qi at the site of mountains and rivers”.

② Pathological Condition identical with zhang qi 瘴氣② , miasmatic qi. Sheng ji zong lu 聖濟總錄 37: 又云江山霧 氣多瘴，凡以其氣鬱蒸而然也。諸家治瘴之法不一 , “Also, it is said that the haze of rivers and mountains is full of miasma . This is always because of pent-up [qi] steaming. The patterns employed by the experts to cure miasma vary”.
① Illness Sign of an uncomfortable feeling of being filled to bursting. Su wen 素問 16: 邪氣著藏， 令人脹 , “The evil qi attaches itself to the depots. [This] makes a person [experience] distension ”.

② Pathological Condition with an uncomfortable feeling of being filled to bursting or with a swelling resulting from abdominal water. Ling shu 靈樞 35: 夫脹者，皆在於藏府之外，排藏府 而郭胸脅，脹皮膚，故命曰脹， “Now, those [qi] that cause distensions are situated outside of the depots and palaces. They attack the depots and palacesand their bulwarks, the chest and ribs, causing the skin to distend. Hence one refers to distension ”.
